required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Evaluate New or Worsening Lens Opacifications in Subjects With Non-metastatic Prostate Cancer Receiving Denosumab for Bone Loss Due to Androgen-Deprivation Therapy
clinical_study.official_title: A Double-blind, Placebo-controlled Study to Evaluate New or Worsening Lens Opacifications in Subjects With Non-metastatic Prostate Cancer Receiving Denosumab for Bone Loss Due to Androgen-Deprivation Therapy

brief_summary.textblock: This is a phase 3, randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled study to evaluate new or worsening lens opacifications in subjects with non-metastatic prostate cancer receiving denosumab for bone loss due to androgen deprivation therapy.

study_design_info.masking: Double Blind (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Subject incidence of lens opacification event development or progression by month 12, based on a change of ≥ 1.0 in P, ≥ 1.0 in C, or ≥ 0.7 in NO in the LOCS III score.
primary_outcome.description: Lens opacification event development or progression

other_outcome.measure: Subject incidence of lens opacification event development or progression by month 12, based on a change of ≥ 1.5 in P, ≥ 1.5 in C, or ≥ 1.5 in NO in the LOCS III score.
other_outcome.description: Lens opacification event development or progression

other_outcome.measure: Subject incidence of lens opacification event development or progression by month 6, based on a change of ≥ 1.0 in P, ≥ 1.0 in C, or ≥ 0.7 in NO in the LOCS III score.
other_outcome.description: Lens opacification event development or progression.

other_outcome.measure: Subject incidence of a decrease from baseline BCVA as measured by a change of ≥ 10 letters on the ETDRS at 4 meters, at months, 3, 6, 9, and 12.
other_outcome.description: Incidence of decreased best corrected visual acuity (BCVA)

other_outcome.measure: Change in refraction needed to achieve BCVA at 3, 6, 9, and 12 as measured by change in sphere
other_outcome.description: Change in refraction needed to achieve BCVA

other_outcome.measure: Adverse event incidence, serious adverse event incidence, changes in safety laboratory analytes (ie, serum chemistry).
other_outcome.description: Safety as measured by adverse events and safety laboratory parameters

other_outcome.measure: Subject incidence of confirmed lens opacification event development or progression by month 12, based on a change of ≥1.0 in P, ≥1.0 in C, or ≥0.7 in NO in the LOCSIII score.
other_outcome.description: Confirmed lens opacification event development or progression. A confirmed lens opacification event development or progression is defined as 2 directly subsequent events per protocol assessments at the same location (P,C,NO) using LOCIII as above.

arm_group.description: Denosumab 60 mg subcutaneously on Day 1 and Month 6
Placebo subcutaneously on Day 1 and Month 6.

intervention.description: Denosumab 60 mg is administered subcutaneously on Day 1 and Month 6.
Placebo administered subcutaneously on Day 1 and Month 6.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Men ≥ 30 years of age with non-metastatic prostate cancer, having undergone bilateral orchiectomy or initiated ADT with GnRH agonists and is expected to continue on ADT for at least 12 months
- Adequate visual accuracy allowing eye testing
- Bone Mineral Density (BMD) requirements: Osteopenia if under 70 years of age; Osteopenia or normal BMD if over 70 years of age
- Signed informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous surgery for cataracts in both eyes, current diagnosis of cataracts, cataracts surgery foreseen in the near future, or ocular disease leading to visual loss
- Diagnosis of osteoporosis
